title: Foundation: Education and Volunteer Experience
description: A degree or diploma in Hospitality Management, Marketing, or Communications provides a good theoretical base. Gain practical experience by volunteering to organize small events for your school, university, or community.

title: Entry-Level Role: Event Assistant / Coordinator
description: Join an event management company, a hotel's banquet department, or a corporate marketing team in an entry-level role. You will support senior planners with logistical tasks like vendor communication, venue setup, and on-site coordination.

title: Event Planner / Executive
description: Take on responsibility for planning and executing smaller events from start to finish. This includes meeting with clients, developing event concepts, creating budgets, and managing all logistical aspects to ensure a successful event.
qualifications: A portfolio of successfully managed events
institutes: Leading event management and MICE (Meetings, Incentives, Conferences, Exhibitions) companies

title: Senior Event Manager
description: Manage large-scale, high-profile events such as major corporate conferences, product launches, or large weddings. You will lead a team of coordinators, manage significant budgets, and be the main point of contact for key clients.
qualifications: Proven track record with large events
institutes: Top-tier event companies and corporate event departments

title: Own Event Management Company
description: With extensive experience and a strong network of clients and suppliers, you can start your own event management company. You can specialize in a niche like corporate events, weddings, or destination management.
